DAZ Studio Plug-in Macros

DZ_PLUGIN_DEFINITION( pluginName )

Macro that provides the exported functions that a plug-in must provide to be loaded by DAZ Studio. Creates a static instance of the DzPlugin class that will manage the new classes provided by the plug-in.

Parameters:
pluginName The description of the plug-in that will be passed to the DzPlugin constructor.


DZ_CUSTOM_PLUGIN_DEFINITION( pluginClass )

Macro that provides the exported functions that a plug-in must provide to be loaded by DAZ Studio. Creates a static instance of a custom DzPlugin sub-class that will manage the new classes provided by the plug-in.

Parameters:
pluginClass The name of the custom DzPlugin sub-class that will be instantiated. It is assumed to have a parameterless default contstructor.


DZ_PLUGIN_AUTHOR( author )

Macro that sets the author string for this plug-in. This macro must follow the DZ_PLUGIN_DEFINITION() macro or the DZ_CUSTOM_PLUGIN_DEFINITION() macro. This macro must appear no more than once in a module (dll/dylib).

Parameters:
author A brief string naming the author of the plug-in.


DZ_PLUGIN_DESCRIPTION( description )

Macro that sets the description text for this plug-in. This macro must follow the DZ_PLUGIN_DEFINITION() macro or the DZ_CUSTOM_PLUGIN_DEFINITION() macro. This macro must appear no more than once in a module (dll/dylib).

Parameters:
description The description of the plug-in, this can be plain text, or can be formatted with RTF/HTML tags.

Example - Linking plug-in documentation, fom the "/docs" folder 

    // Provide a link in About > About Installed Plug-ins... to this plug-in's documentation
    DZ_PLUGIN_DESCRIPTION( QString(
        "<a href=\"%1/Plugins/MyPlugin/MyPluginHelp.htm\"></a>"
        ).arg( dzApp->getDocumentationPath() ) );


DZ_PLUGIN_VERSION( version )

Macro that sets the version for this plug-in. This macro must follow the DZ_PLUGIN_DEFINITION() macro or the DZ_CUSTOM_PLUGIN_DEFINITION() macro. This macro must appear no more than once in a module (dll/dylib).

Parameters:
version The version of the plug-in represented as an unsigned long. Each byte in the unsigned long represents a number in the version e.g. 0x01000000 would be version 1.0.0.0.


DZ_PLUGIN_CLASS_GUID( typeName, guid )

Macro that adds a class type to the types that this plug-in exports.

Parameters:
typeName The name of the DzBase sub-class to add to the classes provided by the plug-in.
guid A globally unique identifier generated by the developer. See guids for more information on class identifiers.


DZ_PLUGIN_ACTIVATION_POLICY( guid, activationPolicy )

Macro that adds activation policy to this plug-in. See DAZ Studio Plug-in Activation and Serialization for more information.

Parameters:
guid A globally unique identifier generated by the developer. See guids for more information on class identifiers.
activationPolicy The activation policy to be used to enable the plug-in class. See DzActivationPolicy and its child classes for more information about activation policies.


DZ_PLUGIN_REGISTRATION_PREFIX( prefix, versionString, descriptionString )

Macro that adds registration data to this plug-in. See DAZ Studio Plug-in Activation and Serialization for more information.

Parameters:
prefix The registration prefix for the plug-in.
versionString A string representation of the serialization version.
descriptionString A user friendly string description of the registration prefix.


DZ_PLUGIN_CLASS_FACTORY( typeName, classID )

Deprecated:
Macro that adds a class type to the types that this plug-in exports. This should only be used for classes which were previously assigned a legacy Class ID. All new classes MUST have a GUID and should use the DZ_PLUGIN_CLASS_GUID() macro. See DAZ Studio Legacy Class IDs for more information. This function will continue to remain available indefinitely but should never be used in new source.
Parameters:
typeName The name of the DzBase sub-class to add to the classes provided by the plug-in.
classID The unique class identifier that will be used to identify the class.
